name: The Internship
body:
Gaby's Internship at Cylix Technologies
===========================

Gaby is a rising senior at McGill University studying Computer Science and International Development Studies. This September she started an internship and is working with the IT Team of Cylix Technologies, Inc.


Day 1: ERPnext and Frappe
------------------------------
*Sept 26, 2016*

---

I have started my internship at Cylix Technologies, Inc. Cylix Technologies is one of the market leaders, as well as one of the fastest growing companies in the **Security and Surveillance Technology Industry** in the Philippines.

I have been assigned an email address: [gaby.di@cylix.ph]() which I can login to at [http://webmail.cylix.ph](). I was also granted access to the company's intranet and WordPress. 



I spent my first 3 hours learning about **ERPnext and Frappe**.

* **ERPNext** is a free and open-source integrated **Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP)** software for the web developed by *Frappé Technologies Pvt. Ltd.* and is built on **MariaDB** database system using a **Python** based server-side framework. 

* **Frappé**  is the Rapid Application Development Framework in Python & JS used to build ERPNext.

### How to install ERPnext

To run ERPnext I had to download **Oracle's VirtualBox** in order to run Ubuntu Linux on a virtual machine which now lives inside my laptop.

* [virtualbox.com]() 

I then mounted the ERPnext iso image file into the virtual machine.

When VirtualBox Boots, login using user: frappe and password: frappe

Afterwards, input the followings command in order to start Frappe Bench. Without this step the host site will not launch.

	cd frappe-bench
	bench start

Then, on the HOST machine (mine is Windows 10), use the browser and go to:

*[ http://localhost 8080]()

and login using:

* user: Administrator
* password: admin

### I learned a few new commands today:**

	ifconfig | grep HWaddr --> Linux, specifically returns MAC address

	ipconfig --> Windows

	ping google.com --> to check there is an active internet connection
	ping facebook.com

	Ctrl + C --> to exit a particular command in terminal/cmdline
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
